# Task

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.



# Data

df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)

Here is the solution using Julia language:

```julia
using DataFrames

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = map(x -> Dates.format(x, "yyyymm"), df.dt)
end

# Testing the function with given data
df = DataFrame(dt=[DateTime(2020, 5, 24), DateTime(2021, 1, 15), DateTime(2022, 12, 5)])
add_yearmonth(df)
```

This function uses the `map` function to apply a function element-wise across an array. In this case, it applies the `Dates.format` function, which formats a DateTime as a string in the specified format. The resulting strings are then concatenated together into a new column "ym".
